Dear Ms. Trotter:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action. Please review the
enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In the event
that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager at 616-552-3662.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & Rule 400.4142 Health services; policies and procedures
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(a) Routine and emergency medical, and dental, and behavioral
health care.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/19/23 Youth B bit a hole in her lip and did not receive timely
medical treatment.
Investigation I left a voice message for Complainant/School Principal and did
not receive a call back.
I notified Foster Care Worker that I was assigned this
investigation. She expressed no additional concerns regarding
the facility.
I reviewed the facility’s history of licensing rule violations.
Youth B was discharged from Girlstown before DCWL received
this complaint. She currently resides with relatives in Michigan’s
upper peninsula.
On 10/26/23 I interviewed Youth B jointly with Government
Worker 2 via conference call. After having dental work on
10/17/23, she said she intentionally bit her lip while it was numb
and wounded it. Asked why she bit her own lip, she said she
wanted to see what it was like. Youth B said Supervisor sent her
out for medical treatment the next day (10/18/23). “The school
forced them to take me…The doctor gave me antibiotics.”
I observed two photos of Youth B’s lip taken by Government
Worker 2 on 10/26/23 (nine days after the initial injury). The
photos showed scabbing on the outside of her left lower lip and
discoloring on the inside her lower lip. Unfortunately, no photos
were taken the day(s) she bit her lip.
I interviewed Supervisor jointly with Government Worker 1 via
phone. She has worked at the facility for four years. Supervisor
said she saw Youth B on 10/17/23 and observed what appeared
to be a bite mark on her left inner lip. “It did not appear to be
actively bleeding…No one mentioned going to urgent care. I
suggested she ice it and she did.” The next day the school nurse
2

called Girlstown and asked that staff take her for medical
treatment. Supervisor believed Youth B bit her lip a second time
the next day at school worsening the original injury.
I interviewed Social Work Intern jointly with Government Worker
1. She said Youth B is a “self-harmer” who bit her lip after a
dental procedure. Social Work Intern took Youth B to urgent care
on 10/18/23 around 1pm. “They said it was already healing, did
not need stitches and prescribed an antibiotic.”
A Girlstown Medical Visit Report completed by urgent care
physician dated 10/18/23 indicated Youth B was seen for a
swollen lip and diagnosed with a lower lip laceration infection.
“Antibiotics now. If symptoms worsen, go to ER. Schedule follow-
up with primary care physician.”
Government Worker 1 had no findings.
Analysis Supervisor observed Youth B’s injured lip on 10/17/23 and
suggested she ice it. She did not feel it required outside medical
treatment. The next day the school nurse recommended Youth B
be taken to urgent care for her lip. Social Work Intern took the
youth to urgent care, and the doctor prescribed antibiotics. After
intentionally biting and injuring her lip on 10/17/23, Supervisor
believes Youth B bit it a second time worsening its condition.
There were no photos of the condition of her lip at the time
Supervisor observed it and no evidence she required immediate
medical treatment after she initially bit it on 10/17/23.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to: (
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 10/20/23 Youth B attempted to AWOL. Staff 1 threw her to the
ground, and slapped and kicked her causing her nose to bleed.
3

Investigation VIDEO
Video of the living room on 10/20/23 at 4:06pm showed the
following:
Youth B enters the living room followed by Staff 1. Staff 1
appears to be verbally confronting Youth B. There are no other
youth or staff in room. Youth B and Staff 1 face one another and
appear to have a verbal disagreement. Youth B moves toward the
stairs and Staff 1 shifts her body appearing to block her, then
grabs the youth’s waist. Youth B falls to the floor and Staff 1
appears to fall on top of her. Youth B and Staff 1 go outside of the
camera’s view.
Youth B said prior to the altercation, she was in a “pissy mood
because I didn’t want to be there, and my worker wouldn’t move
me.” She said she walked to the living room and “Staff 1 was on
my ass, saying I was being ‘smart.’ It was only her third day (on
the job) and she don’t even know policies. I was doing a puzzle
and Staff 1 slid it off the table. I went toward the kitchen to make
a phone call and Staff 1 pushed me into the wall. We fell on the
(living room) stairs and she kicked me in the stomach. She had
me in a headlock on the ground and was lying on top of me.”
Youth B said she walked out of the facility and went AWOL.
Asked if her nose bled, Youth B said it was her lip, which was
already injured, that bled.
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker 1. She said
the incident occurred during her first week as a direct care worker.
Staff 1 denied pushing, kicking, slapping, chasing, blocking, or
restraining Youth B.
Staff 1 stated Youth B was on the phone with her worker and was
overheard saying that if she did not get out of Girlstown,“it would
not be pretty”. After the call ended, Staff 1 said Youth B had UNO
cards and asked for a backpack. Due to her loss of privileges,
Staff 1 said she was not allowed to have cards, but only allowed to
read a book. When Staff 1 redirected Youth B, she said the youth
got upset and called her a “bitch.” “I asked the other girls to clear
the area. Youth B said she’d run right through me. She ran into
my midsection with her head. I grabbed her waist and we fell on
the floor. She was on top of me. I pushed her off me.” No one
witnessed the altercation. “Youth B ran to the stairwell, kicked the
door, and left out the fire exit, setting off the alarm. I called 911
and then Supervisor.” Staff 1 said her body was sore after Youth
B assaulted her and she sought medical treatment the following
day.
4

Shortly after Youth B went AWOL, Staff 1 noticed she was back at
the facility, which surprised and upset Staff 1. She learned the
police brought Youth B back and that “Staff 2 let her in.” At that
point, Staff 1 said she told Staff 2 that prior to going AWOL, Youth
B assaulted her in the living area. Staff 2 informed Supervisor via
phone and Supervisor called the police again. The police returned
to the facility, took a statement from Staff 1 and transported Youth
B to the Wayne County Juvenile Detention Center for assaulting
staff.
Government Worker 1 had no findings.
Analysis Video shows Staff 1 and Youth B engaged in a verbal
disagreement. Staff 1 grabbed the youth’s waist and they fell
together on the living room stairs. It does not show Staff 1 push
Youth B into the wall, throw her to the floor, kick her or slap her as
Youth B alleged. It also does not show Youth B assault Staff 1 as
Staff 1 claimed.
Youth B told investigators she was not injured as a result of the
incident. Staff 1 told us she felt sore and sought medical
treatment the next day. No other staff or youths witnessed this
incident. There is no evidence Staff 1 used any type of physical
punishment toward Youth B.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & Rule 400.4109 Program statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 violated the facility's policy by failing to write an incident
report within 24 hours.
Investigation The altercation between Staff 1 and Youth B occurred on
10/20/23. When I requested the incident report on 10/24/23, it
had not been completed. Staff 1 said she was shaken by the
incident and did not write an incident report until 10/25/23.
5

I reviewed the agency’s Critical Incident policy which indicates
incident reports are to be completed by the staff involved within 24
hours.
Analysis Staff 1 did not follow the facility’s Critical Incident Policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements: staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position assigned.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 engaged in a verbal power struggle with Youth B that led to
them falling to the floor.
Investigation Staff 1 confronted Youth B after she engaged in prohibited
activities based on her Loss of Privilege. Youth B called Staff 1 a
“bitch” and an argument ensued. Video shows Youth B moving
toward the stairs and Staff 1 shifting her body appearing to block
Youth B. Staff 1 grabbed Youth B at the waist, and they both fell
to the floor. Staff 1 engaged in a verbal power struggle with Youth
B while Youth B was escalated. The verbal argument became
physical and could have been avoided had Staff 1 backed away
and utilized verbal de-escalation techniques.
Analysis Staff 1 worked at the facility only three days when this incident
occurred. She lacks the experience to perform the duties of her
assigned position. Staff 1 needs additional training on utilizing
verbal de-escalation techniques and physical boundaries when
youths are escalated.
Conclusion Violation Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
